content:
In which of the following wavelengths does DNA absorb the best:
W) 3,900 angstroms
X) 260 nanometers
Y) 340 nanometers
Z) 540 nanometers
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is closest to the diameter of a
plasmodesmata (read as: PLAS-mo-dez-MAH-tah):
W) 2 angstroms
X) 60 nanometers
Y) 80 microns
Z) 180 microns
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: X) 60 NANOMETERS(Solution: this is the only logical size considering the average plant cell size and the size oftransported molecules)

content:
Name the 2 different bond angles present in a molecule with
octahedral geometry, such as in SF :
6
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
In a titration experiment, it takes 20.0 milliliters of a 0.05 molar
barium hydroxide, Ba(OH) , solution to neutralize 40 milliliters of a nitric acid, or HNO , solution to
2 3
the equivalence point. Calculate the molarity of HNO , rounded to the second decimal place:
3
subject: CHEMISTRY
answer: 0.05(Solution: 0.05 mol Ba(OH) /L × 0.02L = 0.001 mol Ba(OH) × 2 = 0.002 mol; 0.002 mol ÷ 0.04L2 2= 0.05M)High School Round 16 Page 1

content:
By words or numbers, identify all of the following 4 choices that
MUST be true for 2 objects in thermal equilibrium:
1) they both must radiate no energy in any direction
2) they must be at the same temperature
3) they both must have the same thermal expansion coefficients
4) they must have the same internal energy
subject: PHYSICS

content:
How many kilojoules of thermal energy, rounded to the first decimal
place, must be lost from a 250-gram block of Teflon with a specific heat of 1 kilojoule per kilogram
kelvin, to lower the block’s temperature from 125º C to 75º C?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
If a point has polar coordinates (3, π), what are the rectangular
coordinates?
subject: MATH
answer: (–3, 0)(Solution: x = 3 cos π = –3 and y = 3 sin π = 0)

content:
The graph of the polar equation, r = 5 – 5 cosine θ, is a cardioid. In
which two quadrants is most of the area of this cardioid?
subject: MATH
answer: II AND III (ACCEPT: 2 AND 3 or SECOND AND THIRD)High School Round 16 Page 2

content:
Which of the following is a coarse-grained igneous rock
primarily containing plagioclase feldspar, amphibole and biotite:
W) gabbro
X) basalt
Y) diorite
Z) granite
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Of the 3 basic types of magma on Earth, which one generally
has the LOWEST eruptive temperature?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is the source of alpha radiation
most often used in household ionization smoke detectors:
W) americium-241
X) uranium-238
Y) radium-226
Z) iron-59
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Calculate the heating degree day in the U.S. if the day’s
high temperature is 70ºF and the low is 30ºF:
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
Order the following 3 stages from the EARLIEST to the
LATEST in the evolution of a G-type star of 2 solar masses: red giant; T-tauri; white dwarf
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
If a star has a surface temperature of 3,000 degrees kelvin, a core
temperature of 100 million Kelvin, and a luminosity of 2,000-times our Sun, choosing from upper
right, upper left, lower left, and lower right, where on an H-R diagram would it most likely be
found?
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: UPPER RIGHT(Solution: this describes a red giant)

content:
What reduced coenzyme donates its electrons to complex-one in the
electron transport system?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
In a double reciprocal plot of Michaelis-Menton kinetics, what is
the effect of a competitive inhibitor:
W) change in the vertical axis intercept
X) change in the slope only
Y) change in the horizontal axis intercept only
Z) change in both vertical and horizontal axes intercepts
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: X) CHANGE IN THE SLOPE ONLYHigh School Round 16 Page 4

content:
What is the bond order for each oxygen-oxygen bond in the ozone
or O molecule?
3
3
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Hydrogen gas effuses through a pinhole opening from one
compartment to another about how many times as fast as nitrogen gas:
W) 2.4-times
X) 3.7-times
Y) 5.3-times
Z) 8.2-times
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Which of the following best describes why the optical spectrum of
an atom exists as discrete lines and not as a continuous spectrum:
W) atoms have electrons with unit charge
X) all atoms when excited emit light
Y) all energy levels of atoms are quantized
Z) all electrons have spin
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Y) ALL ENERGY LEVELS OF ATOMS ARE QUANTIZED

content:
Which of the following BEST describes one of Maxwell’s
equations that is a mathematical conceptualization of Faraday’s law:
W) a magnetic B-field is a solenoid vector field
X) an EMF induced in a conductor opposes that motion
Y) induced currents are caused by the magnetic field and in opposition to the opposed flux
Z) a time-varying B-field produces an E-field
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Z) A TIME-VARYING B-FIELD PRODUCES AN E-FIELDHigh School Round 16 Page 5

content:
At x = − , the graph of y = x3 is:
2
W) increasing and concave up
X) increasing and concave down
Y) decreasing and concave up
Z) decreasing and concave down
subject: MATH
answer: X) INCREASING AND CONCAVE DOWN(Solution: at the indicated value the 1st derivative is positive (implying increasing) and the 2ndderivative is negative (implying concave down))

content:
The point (3, 2) is reflected across the graph of y = 6 and the resulting
point is then reflected across the graph of y = x. What are the coordinates of the final point?
subject: MATH
answer: (10, 3)(Solution: the 1st reflection  (3,10); 2nd reflection interchanges the x and y coordinates)

content:
According to EPA nationwide emission trends for
common air pollutants and excluding fires and dust, which of the following accounted for the least
amount of emissions in the past 5 years:
W) volatile organic compounds
X) carbon monoxide
Y) sulfur dioxide
Z) particulate matter
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: Z) PARTICULATE MATTER(Solution: VOC ~ 15; CO ~ 81 mT/yr; SO ~ 13; particulates ~ 3)2

content:
Without leap days every 4 years, the winter solstice
would start on what month and day after 70 years?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE
answer: JANUARY 7 (ACCEPT: JANUARY 6 TO 8)(Solution: 17 days later)High School Round 16 Page 6

content:
In what layer of Earth’s atmosphere do most meteors
experience the most heating?
subject: EARTH SCIENCE
EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Which of the following is LEAST likely to occur when
viewed from mid-northern latitudes in the month of August:
W) Venus passing within 2º of Saturn
X) Neptune at opposition
Y) the Moon at apogee on the 1st of the month and perigee at the 29th of the month
Z) the Moon passing within 5º of Uranus
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Y) THE MOON AT APOGEE ON THE 1ST OF THE MONTH AND PERIGEE ATTHE 29TH OF THE MONTH(Solution: apogee and perigee are separated by about 14-15 days)

content:
Which of the following was seen from mid-northern latitudes
by casual stargazers as a bright light in August of 2008 at midnight, about 1/2 way up the southern
horizon:
W) Venus
X) Vega
Y) Jupiter
Z) Uranus
subject: ASTRONOMY
answer: Y) JUPITER(Solution: Venus and Vega are not there at this time of year and Uranus is never that bright)High School Round 16 Page 7

content:
What is the primary calcium-binding protein in eukaryotic cells, that
is about 148 amino acids long, and has a wide variety of functions often through kinases and
phosphatases (read as: foss-fah-TAY-sis)?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
Which of the following is the RNA complementary sequence of
the following sequence: 5’CCGCGA 3’ (read as: 5-prime, CCGCGS, 3-prime)
W) 5’ UCGCGG 3’ (read as: 5-prime, UCGCGG, 3-prime)
X) 5’ GGCGCU 3’
Y) 5’ GGCGCT 3’
Z) 5’ TCGCGG 3’
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
For the following 3 processes, predict whether the change in
enthalpy, or ∆Sº (read as: delta S naught), is positive or negative, respectively:
1) decomposition of ammonium nitrate
2) sublimation of dry ice
3) condensation of gaseous iodine to liquid iodine
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
Consider the following equilibrium reaction,
PCl ↔ PCl + Cl . If a 1-liter flask contains 0.02 moles of PCl and 0.02 moles of Cl at
5(gas) 3(gas) 2(gas) 3 2
equilibrium, how many moles of PCl are in the flask. Assume the equilibrium constant is 5 × 10–2.
5
subject: CHEMISTRY

content: During beta minus decay, what nucleon type is reduced by one?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Which of the following is NOT true of the Hall effect:
W) it can be used to measure the strength of a magnetic field
X) it is a consequence of a current carrying wire in a magnetic field
Y) it was one of the first direct indications that negative charges are what move in conductors
Z) it cannot distinguish between positive and negative particles
subject: PHYSICS
answer: Z) IT CANNOT DISTINGUISH BETWEEN POSITIVE AND NEGATIVEPARTICLES

content:
What are the Ice Cube observatory under construction at
the South Pole and the ANTARES telescope off the coast of France primarily designed to detect?
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
During the winter solstice in the northern hemisphere,
which of the following northern latitude positions will have a day length of 10.1 hours:
W) 30º
X) 40º
Y) 50º
Z) 60º
subject: GENERAL SCIENCE

content:
During the past 500,000 years, there have been how many
periods of major glaciation on Earth:
W) 2
X) 3
Y) 4
Z) 5
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
A rising parcel of air reaches the lifting condensation
level at 2,000 meters at a dew point temperature of 15ºC. At 3,000 meters, the temperature of this
parcel of air will on average be:
W) 15ºC
X) 10ºC
Y) 6ºC
Z) 3ºC
subject: EARTH SCIENCE

content:
Of the following 5 functions identify all that are NOT differentiable for
all real numbers: | x | (read as: absolute value of x); cosine(x); tangent(x); ex; the greatest integer
function
subject: MATH
answer: | x |; TAN(x); THE GREATEST INTEGER FUNCTION

content:
The curve defined by the equation, Ax2 + Bx + Cy2 + Dy + E =0, can be
an ellipse if which of the constants are positive?
subject: MATH
answer: A AND CHigh School Round 16 Page 10

content: What 3 elements are most prominent in the carbon fusion cycle?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
If the surface of a star is 15,000 kelvin, at what wavelength, in
nanometers rounded to the nearest whole number, does it emit its maximum energy?
subject: ASTRONOMY

content:
What cell type is MOST directly responsible for secreting the bone
matrix in developing humans?

content:
What specific human bone cell is antagonistic to osteoblasts and is
known to cause apoptosis (read as: A-pop-TOE-sis) of osetoblasts in vitro?

content:
What is the most common name for the conformation that the
ring structure of cyclohexane adopts to reach a strain-free value?
subject: CHEMISTRY

content:
What is the name of the universal constant that relates atomic spectra
of elements to that of hydrogen?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Assuming the universal gravitational constant is 6.67 × 10–11
newton-meters squared per kilogram squared, what is the gravitational attraction, in newtons,
between two, 10-kilogram perfectly uniform spheres separated by a center-to-center distance of 10
meters?
subject: PHYSICS

content:
Intestinal absorption of what vitamin is most directly dependent on
intrinsic factor?
subject: BIOLOGY

content:
What plant hormone is primarily responsible for apical dominance in
angiosperms?
subject: BIOLOGY
answer: AUXIN (ACCEPT: INDOLE-ACETIC ACID or IAA)High School Round 16 Page 13
